title: Article – exists in BO (and other branches) but not on specific POS
text: If the article can't be scanned on the POS (and you can't look it up either), but it exists in BO (and in other branches), then open the article, change, save and then it should be transfered to the POS. If that doesn't work, create a Learning file in BO, copy it to the POS, import it and try again. If it still doesn't work, have them send an email to supportcases.europe@k3btg.com.
description:
If the article can't be scanned on the POS (and you can't look it up either), but it exists in BO (and in other branches), then open the article, change, save and then it should be transfered to the POS.

 

If that doesn't work, create a Learning file in BO, copy it to the POS, import it and try again.

 

If it still doesn't work, have them send an email to supportcases.europe@k3btg.com.

title: Card terminal is not working
text: If the PinPad is new: 1. does the customer also have a new cable in use? The old cable can no longer be used, an RS-232 cable is required. The customer must obtain this from the EC provider (e.g. https://www.vr-dienste.de/produkt/kassenkabel-ingenico-ict-iwl-rs232-seriell-3-meter/) 2. has the EC hotline changed the PinPad to the following configurations? ZVT operating mode Serial interface RS232 If this all is okay (or if the PinPad is not new): The following cash register parameters must be correct (can be found in Cash register->Function->System->Cash register parameters->All parameters) PinPadComport = Must be the ComPort that is displayed when you click on "Function"->"PinPad"->"Search connection" in the cash register (It does not matter which ComPort is on the EC terminal. If COM1 is displayed on the EC device, this only means that the connection on the EC device is COM1, on the cash register this can be anything from COM1 to COM99). PinpadKonfig = Usually "0" PinpadProduct = Usually "4", if you want the EC device to be inactive then "0" PinPadComPortStopBit = Should not normally be changed. However, if the terminal does not work, you can try to change this parameter (if this does not help: reset to the original value!) Test the connection from the card device to the PC: In Cowiskasse: Function->PinPad->Look for connection If the cash register does not find anything here, the PinPad is not properly connected to the PC. Alternatively, you can also check the connection to the PC as follows: Transfer ZVT-COMM (program, found under: K3 Scandinavian Consultant - Card Terminals - All Documents (sharepoint.com)) to the customer and install it there. Close the cash register and try all COM ports. If a transaction was carried out in the PinPad but not in the cash register (=Pinpad prints receipt, cash register does not print receipt/money was debited from the customer's account, but transaction is missing in the cash register) 1. check the log file of the PinPad to see whether the transaction was actually carried out successfully on the PinPad C:\Cowis\COwiskasse\Daten\PINPADPROTOKOLL.TXT Here you can see the amount at the beginning of a transaction and if the transaction has not taken place, "Abort" is written a little further down. Attention: It is quite possible that the transaction was unsuccessful several times, but still went through once, so check all transactions in the PinPad log that begin with the purchase amount of the transaction in question. 2. if the payment has taken place in the PinPad but is missing in the cash register, it must now be registered in the cash register, but without money flowing. To do this, you must 2.1 Deactivate PinPad: Function->Cash register parameters->All parameters->PinpadProduct to "0" 2.2 Carry out the transaction again with the same payment method 2.3 Reactivate pinpad: Function->Cash register parameters->All parameters->Pinpad product switch back to previous value (usually "4")
description:
If the PinPad is new:


1. does the customer also have a new cable in use? The old cable can no longer be used, an RS-232 cable is required. The customer must obtain this from the EC provider (e.g. https://www.vr-dienste.de/produkt/kassenkabel-ingenico-ict-iwl-rs232-seriell-3-meter/)


2. has the EC hotline changed the PinPad to the following configurations?


ZVT operating mode

Serial interface RS232




If this all is okay (or if the PinPad is not new):



The following cash register parameters must be correct (can be found in Cash register->Function->System->Cash register parameters->All parameters)


PinPadComport = Must be the ComPort that is displayed when you click on "Function"->"PinPad"->"Search connection" in the cash register (It does not matter which ComPort is on the EC terminal. If COM1 is displayed on the EC device, this only means that the connection on the EC device is COM1, on the cash register this can be anything from COM1 to COM99).

PinpadKonfig = Usually "0"

PinpadProduct = Usually "4", if you want the EC device to be inactive then "0"

PinPadComPortStopBit = Should not normally be changed. However, if the terminal does not work, you can try to change this parameter (if this does not help: reset to the original value!)



Test the connection from the card device to the PC:


In Cowiskasse: Function->PinPad->Look for connection


If the cash register does not find anything here, the PinPad is not properly connected to the PC.



Alternatively, you can also check the connection to the PC as follows:


Transfer ZVT-COMM (program, found under: K3 Scandinavian Consultant - Card Terminals - All Documents (sharepoint.com)) to the customer and install it there.

Close the cash register and try all COM ports.



If a transaction was carried out in the PinPad but not in the cash register (=Pinpad prints receipt, cash register does not print receipt/money was debited from the customer's account, but transaction is missing in the cash register)



1. check the log file of the PinPad to see whether the transaction was actually carried out successfully on the PinPad


C:\Cowis\COwiskasse\Daten\PINPADPROTOKOLL.TXT


Here you can see the amount at the beginning of a transaction and if the transaction has not taken place, "Abort" is written a little further down. Attention: It is quite possible that the transaction was unsuccessful several times, but still went through once, so check all transactions in the PinPad log that begin with the purchase amount of the transaction in question.



2. if the payment has taken place in the PinPad but is missing in the cash register, it must now be registered in the cash register, but without money flowing. To do this, you must 


2.1 Deactivate PinPad: Function->Cash register parameters->All parameters->PinpadProduct to "0" 

2.2 Carry out the transaction again with the same payment method

2.3 Reactivate pinpad: Function->Cash register parameters->All parameters->Pinpad product switch back to previous value (usually "4")

title: Company name - change/edit
Daily Closing statement - reprint
text: On POS: Funktion -> Listen -> Tg.-Abschl. nachdrucken -> choose the date
description:
On POS: 

Funktion -> Listen -> Tg.-Abschl. nachdrucken -> choose the date

title: Data Exchange – POS (only for DFÜ)
text: In BO (Warenwirtschaft): Run data exchange (Datenaustausch) and missing DFÜ Packages (verlorene DFÜ Pakete). On POS: Sign in -> Funktion -> Daten -> Datenaustausch It's also a good idea to search for "verlorenen DFÜ Paketen" Sign in -> Funktion -> Daten -> Verlorene DFÜ Pakete
description:
In BO (Warenwirtschaft):

 

Run data exchange (Datenaustausch) and missing DFÜ Packages (verlorene DFÜ Pakete).

 

On POS:

 

Sign in -> Funktion -> Daten -> Datenaustausch

 

It's also a good idea to search for "verlorenen DFÜ Paketen"

 

Sign in -> Funktion -> Daten -> Verlorene DFÜ Pakete

title: Data exchange failure (main solution)
text: If data exchange fails with a message about unreadable packages (Inhaltsfehler bei Paket), the error can be that the POS has lost its number/name. POS (Kasse) Funktion -> System -> Kassen-Parameter -> Alle Parameter 3: -> KaSvEigeneKenn (to find the number of the POS) e.g. K0013 4: -> DFÜFormat 5: Change 2 (Mit 'ZIP'-Datei) to 1 (Mit 'DAT'-Datei) and click Speichern (Save) The POS will restart and possibly complain about the POS number. BO (Warenwirtschaft) Kassenabschlüsse -> Einstellungen -> Alle -> Kassen -> DFÜFormat Find the right POS (according to the number you found on the POS) Change 2 to 1 and click Übernehmen (Save) 10: BO: Kassenabschlüsse -> Extras -> Verlorene DFÜ-Pakete 12: Choose the right POS and click OK Windows: Find the exportet packages here: Copy them to the POS pc into the RECEIVE folder Restart POS to let it receive the packages. POS: Funktion -> Daten -> Verlorene DFÜ-Pakete Windows: Copy the exportet files from here: To the BO PC here: BO: Run the data exchange in Cowis.net: Kassenabschlüsse -> Extras -> Datenaustausch Festplatte Remeber to set both POS and BO back to Remote DFÜ. That should correct the problem. If it does not, you will have to resort to Resetting DFÜ instead. Read more here
description:
If data exchange fails with a message about unreadable packages (Inhaltsfehler bei Paket), the error can be that the POS has lost its number/name. 

 

  1. POS (Kasse)

 

  1. Funktion -> System -> Kassen-Parameter -> Alle Parameter 

3: -> KaSvEigeneKenn (to find the number of the POS) e.g. K0013

4: -> DFÜFormat

  1. 5: Change 2 (Mit 'ZIP'-Datei) to 1 (Mit 'DAT'-Datei) and click Speichern (Save)

 

The POS will restart and possibly complain about the POS number.

 

  1. BO (Warenwirtschaft)

 

  1. Kassenabschlüsse -> Einstellungen -> Alle -> Kassen -> DFÜFormat

 

  1. Find the right POS (according to the number you found on the POS)

 

  1. Change 2 to 1 and click Übernehmen (Save)

 

 

10: BO:

 

  1. Kassenabschlüsse -> Extras -> Verlorene DFÜ-Pakete

12: Choose the right POS and click OK

 

  1. Windows:

 

  1. Find the exportet packages here:

 

 

  1. Copy them to the POS pc into the RECEIVE folder

 

 

  1. Restart POS to let it receive the packages.

 

  1. POS:

 

  1. Funktion -> Daten -> Verlorene DFÜ-Pakete
    1. Windows:

  2.  

    1. Copy the exportet files from here:

  3.  

     

    1. To the BO PC here:

  4.  

     

     

    1. BO: 

  5.  

    1. Run the data exchange in Cowis.net:

  6.  

    1. Kassenabschlüsse -> Extras -> Datenaustausch Festplatte

  7. Remeber to set both POS and BO back to Remote DFÜ.

     

    That should correct the problem.

     

    If it does not, you will have to resort to Resetting DFÜ instead. 

     

    Read more here

title: Deleted orders - can they be recreated?
text: Q: Deleted orders. Can they be recreated in Cowis? A: No
description:
Q: Deleted orders. Can they be recreated in Cowis?

 

A: No

title: DFÜ - Probleme mit Datenaustausch
text: Relativ einfache Lösung: DFÜ Verfahren in Cowis und Cowiskasse MANUELL von Remote auf Datei DFÜ umstellen An Kasse verlorene DFÜ Pakete manuell in Receive der Kasse auf dem Server Als Cowsys in Cowis DFÜ ausführen Das ganze paar mal hin und her, also auch von Cowis an Kasse mit verlorene DFÜ Und wenn alles wieder passt, in Cowis umstellen auf Remote umstellen (Param 3) Pakete an Kasse einlesen und alles läuft
description:
Relativ einfache Lösung:

 

DFÜ Verfahren in Cowis und Cowiskasse MANUELL von Remote auf Datei DFÜ umstellen

 

An Kasse verlorene DFÜ Pakete manuell in Receive der Kasse auf dem Server

 

Als Cowsys in Cowis DFÜ ausführen

 

Das ganze paar mal hin und her, also auch von Cowis an Kasse mit verlorene DFÜ

 

Und wenn alles wieder passt, in Cowis umstellen auf Remote umstellen (Param 3) 

 

Pakete an Kasse einlesen und alles läuft

title: Discount – Barcode lower VAT
text: Q: Can you print a barcode to get the right VAT, so the shop assistants can just scan it? A: No.
description:
Q: Can you print a barcode to get the right VAT, so the shop assistants can just scan it?

 

A: No.

title: Discount - can you add discounts to several items at once?
text: Click on an empty line under Artikel -> enter discount amount (e.g. 30) -> click the % button -> choose with kind of discount it is (Beleg = entire sale, Folgende Position = anything after this line, Aktuelle Position = this line only) -> choose discountreason (Reduzierungsgrund) -> OK
description: Click on an empty line under Artikel -> enter discount amount (e.g. 30) -> click the % button -> choose with kind of discount it is (Beleg = entire sale, Folgende Position = anything after this line, Aktuelle Position = this line only) -> choose discountreason (Reduzierungsgrund) -> OK

title: Error message "Barcode lernen"
text: If the customer has added new items and tries to scan them on the POS, but gets this message "Barcode lernen", it means that the POS cannot recognize the EAN code and the POS needs to be updated. Run a "Verlorene DFÜ Packete" on the POS and on the Server and nudge the data exchange. This should correct that problem.
description:
If the customer has added new items and tries to scan them on the POS, but gets this message "Barcode lernen", it means that the POS cannot recognize the EAN code and the POS needs to be updated.

 

Run a "Verlorene DFÜ Packete" on the POS and on the Server and nudge the data exchange.

 

This should correct that problem.

title: Individual texts on receipt
text: If individual texts are desired on the receipt, such as Merry Christmas or Happy Easter, you can set this manually at the PRO cash register: First, it is best to make a backup of the existing forms: Cowiskasse -> Funktion -> System -> Formulare aus-/einlagern Auslagern Alle OK Dateiname FORMULARE.TXT anpassen wie mit Datum versehene C:\COWIS\CowisKasse\DATEN\FORMULARE_11102022.TXT Speichern Formulare sind gesichert Formulare ändern Funktion -> System -> Formular-Verwaltung Formular Verkauf anklicken Formular klicken Editor öffnet sich Text an gewünschter Stelle einfügen Schließen Kreuz und Frage nach Speichern mit Ja beantworten
description:
If individual texts are desired on the receipt, such as 

Merry Christmas or Happy Easter, you can set this manually at the PRO cash register:

First, it is best to make a backup of the existing forms:

Cowiskasse -> Funktion -> System -> Formulare aus-/einlagern
Auslagern
Alle
 OK

Dateiname FORMULARE.TXT anpassen wie mit Datum versehene
C:\COWIS\CowisKasse\DATEN\FORMULARE_11102022.TXT
 Speichern

Formulare sind gesichert
 
  

Formulare ändern
 Funktion -> System -> Formular-Verwaltung
 Formular Verkauf anklicken
 Formular klicken
 Editor öffnet sich
 
 Text an gewünschter Stelle einfügen
  


 Schließen Kreuz und Frage nach Speichern mit Ja beantworten

title: Installation of new POS (not new Branch)
text: In the Cowis folder CowisKasse (add number if there are more) create a new folder for the POS called CowisKasse. Create Transmit and Receive folders in the new folder Install program (choose only POS) In BO under Kassenabschlüsse -> Datei -> Kasse -> Neu create a new POS Fiskaly Info ist first added when the POS has been created.
description:
1. In the Cowis folder CowisKasse (add number if there are more) create a new folder for the POS called CowisKasse.

 

  1. Create Transmit and Receive folders in the new folder

 

  1. Install program (choose only POS)

 

  1. In BO under Kassenabschlüsse -> Datei -> Kasse -> Neu create a new POS

 

 

  1. Fiskaly Info ist first added when the POS has been created.

title: Labelprinter prints too much/too little
text: Prints 1 lable, then 4 empty ones, then another one. Printer should probably be calibrated. Zebraprinter LP 2824 plus Press the green button until the printer blinks twice, then release and try to print again. If that does not work, try wiping the sensor down with a soft cloth, or try to clean the roller.
description:
Prints 1 lable, then 4 empty ones, then another one.

 

Printer should probably be calibrated.

 

Zebraprinter LP 2824 plus

Press the green button until the printer blinks twice, then release and try to print again.

 

If that does not work, try wiping the sensor down with a soft cloth, or try to clean the roller.

title: New logo on exchange label
text: Save the logo in e.g. CowisKasse -> Vorlagen (size and format is irrelevant. Cowis accepts all formats and sizes) Open Cowis POS -> Funktion Check that the right printer is installed (e.g. Zebra TLP) System -> Logische Drucker Click Abbruch (Cancel) Click Service and sign on as COWSYS (pw c0w15!) Click Schließen to close that window Click Allgemein -> Ersatzetikett drucken Choose random Article by clicking OK Choose a random Article and clik OK Click Ja on Design Anpassen (Adjust Design) Choose Einfügen (Insert) Click Bild (Picture) With left mousekey, create a field at the top of the label Choose Datei (File) Locate and choose the logo you saved beforehand and click Öffnen (Open) You can adjust the placement of the logo, but not the size. Click Save You get a print preview of the label. Clck Druckvorschau schließen Ask customer to test if the setup is correct.
description:
Save the logo in e.g. CowisKasse -> Vorlagen (size and format is irrelevant. Cowis accepts all formats and sizes)

 

Open Cowis POS -> Funktion

 

 

Check that the right printer is installed (e.g. Zebra TLP)

 

System -> Logische Drucker

 

 

 

 

Click Abbruch (Cancel)

 

Click Service and sign on as COWSYS (pw c0w15!)

 

 

Click Schließen to close that window

 

 

Click Allgemein -> Ersatzetikett drucken

 

 

 

Choose random Article by clicking OK

 

 

Choose a random Article and clik OK

 

 

 

Click Ja on Design Anpassen (Adjust Design)

 

 

Choose Einfügen (Insert)

 

Click Bild (Picture)

 

With left mousekey, create a field at the top of the label

 

 

Choose Datei (File)

 

 

Locate and choose the logo you saved beforehand and click Öffnen (Open)

 

 

You can adjust the placement of the logo, but not the size.

 

Click Save 

 

 

You get a print preview of the label. Clck Druckvorschau schließen

 

 

 

Ask customer to test if the setup is correct.

title: Password demo mode (Passwort DEMO Modus)
text: The password for the demo mode is 0000 by default.
description: The password for the demo mode is 0000 by default.

title: POS won't start (shows error message)
text: Cowis SQL Service has probably not been started or hangs Open Services, find SQL Service (Cowis) finden and, if it's not running, start it. If it is running, stop and start. Restart of the POS PC usually does the same.
description:
Cowis SQL Service has probably not been started or hangs

 

Open Services, find SQL Service (Cowis) finden and, if it's not running, start it. If it is running, stop and start.

 

Restart of the POS PC usually does the same.

title: Receipt - could not be signed by TSE
text: If TSE can't sign, it will say so at the bottom of the receipt. That can mean that the Internet is not working, TSE hasn't been installed or is doesn't answer. Is this on a Windows 7 PC, it is possible that it is not running the latest .NET Framework. Find latest version here: Download Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5.2 (Offline Installer) for Windows Vista SP2, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2008 SP2, Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2 from Official Microsoft Download Center
description:
If TSE can't sign, it will say so at the bottom of the receipt. That can mean that the Internet is not working, TSE hasn't been installed or is doesn't answer.

 

Is this on a Windows 7 PC, it is possible that it is not running the latest .NET Framework.

 

Find latest version here:

Download Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5.2 (Offline Installer) for Windows Vista SP2, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2008 SP2, Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2 from Official Microsoft Download Center

title: Repayment to credit card
text: Q: Can you repay a return to the credit card? A: Technically yes, but this has to be commissioned by the customer companywide.
description:
Q: Can you repay a return to the credit card?

 

A: Technically yes, but this has to be commissioned by the customer companywide.

title: Repeat sale on credit card without the card terminal asking for a card
text: If a sale has been completed on the card terminal, but the POS has not saved the sale (temporary error/interruption), the sale can be repeated by turning off the card terminal in Cowis, reapeating the steps of the sale, choosing EC-Card as payment method, saying yes to printing the receipt, then turning the card terminal back on in Cowis. 1. 2. 3. 4. 5. 6. It will ask if you want to print. Say yes. Then repeat steps 1-4 and set the PinPadProdukt back to ZVT (Standard) to reactivate the card terminal.
description:
If a sale has been completed on the card terminal, but the POS has not saved the sale (temporary error/interruption), the sale can be repeated by turning off the card terminal in Cowis, reapeating the steps of the sale, choosing EC-Card as payment method, saying yes to printing the receipt, then turning the card terminal back on in Cowis.

 

1.

 

2.

 

3.

 

4.

 

5.

 

6.

 

It will ask if you want to print. Say yes.

 

Then repeat steps 1-4 and set the PinPadProdukt back to ZVT (Standard) to reactivate the card terminal.

title: Return article - reduced/not reduced
text: The customer has bought an article at standard price, but the price was actually reduced Customer returns and wants to be paid the difference. How do you do that? Umtaush(Exchange) -> pay back the amount in cash -> sell the article at the correct price again
description:
The customer has bought an article at standard price, but the price was actually reduced

 

Customer returns and wants to be paid the difference.

 

How do you do that?

 

Umtaush(Exchange) -> pay back the amount in cash -> sell the article at the correct price again

title: TSE Failure (Ausfall der TSE)
text: Der Ausfall der TSE ist nie mit irgendwelchen Kassiervorgängen verbunden sondern die TSE kann ausfallen wenn: Kurzfristige Internetstörung Keine Verbindung zum TSE Server von Fiskaly, meistens verbunden mit einer kurzfristigen oder langfristigen Internetstörung Ausfall des TSE Fiskaly Servers Erhöhter Zugriff im allgemeinen auf den TSE Fiskaly Server (zu viele deutschlandweite gleichzeitige Zugriffe) und zu lange Antwortzeit des Servers Manchmal auch fehlerhafte Windowskomponente (was ich aber hier ausschließen würde da es sonst immer nicht ginge) The failure of the TSE is never connected with any checkout operations but the TSE can fail if: Short-term Internet disruption. No connection to Fiskaly's TSE server, usually associated with a short-term or long-term Internet disruption. Failure of the TSE Fiskaly server Increased access in general to the TSE Fiskaly server (too many nationwide simultaneous accesses) and too long response time of the server Sometimes also faulty Windows component (which I would exclude here however since it would not go otherwise always)
description:
Der Ausfall der TSE ist nie mit irgendwelchen Kassiervorgängen verbunden sondern die TSE kann ausfallen wenn:

 

  • Kurzfristige Internetstörung
  • Keine Verbindung zum TSE Server von Fiskaly, meistens verbunden mit einer kurzfristigen oder langfristigen Internetstörung
  • Ausfall des TSE Fiskaly Servers
  • Erhöhter Zugriff im allgemeinen auf den TSE Fiskaly Server (zu viele deutschlandweite gleichzeitige Zugriffe) und zu lange Antwortzeit des Servers
  • Manchmal auch fehlerhafte Windowskomponente (was ich aber hier ausschließen würde da es sonst immer nicht ginge)

 

 

The failure of the TSE is never connected with any checkout operations but the TSE can fail if: 

    

  • Short-term Internet disruption.  
  • No connection to Fiskaly's TSE server, usually associated with a short-term or long-term Internet disruption.  
  • Failure of the TSE Fiskaly server  
  • Increased access in general to the TSE Fiskaly server (too many nationwide simultaneous accesses) and too long response time of the server  
  • Sometimes also faulty Windows component (which I would exclude here however since it would not go otherwise always)

title: TSE Info Export
text: If a customer needs POS data for a certain period for the tax department, do as follows: Open POS -> Funktion -> TSE -> Export Set start date (Startdatum) and end date (Enddatum) and click OK The data will be exported to the indicated folder (usually Cowis/CowisKasse into a folder called TSE Export. The folder will contain two .tar files, which can be forwarded to the customer.
description:
If a customer needs POS data for a certain period for the tax department, do as follows:

 

Open POS -> Funktion -> TSE -> Export

 

 

 

Set start date (Startdatum) and end date (Enddatum) and click OK

 

 

 

The data will be exported to the indicated folder (usually Cowis/CowisKasse into a folder called TSE Export.

 

The folder will contain two .tar files, which can be forwarded to the customer.

title: TSE won't/can't sign
text: It's possible that the .Net Framework 4.5.2 is not installed, or that TSE has not yet been installed, or has not yet been updated to V02. Test if the right framework is installed first. If the TSE tab is not available on the POS, TSE has not been installed.
description:
It's possible that the .Net Framework 4.5.2 is not installed, or that TSE has not yet been installed, or has not yet been updated to V02.

 

Test if the right framework is installed first.

 

If the TSE tab is not available on the POS, TSE has not been installed.

title: Update for POS won't install automatically
text: If the download for the update of the POS doesn't work, check first if it has been downloaded already. You can find in C:\CowisKasse\Update (or where ever the POS program is installed). Sometimes they run it from a network location. It's called something like UpdateKasse-xxxxxx.zip. If it hasn't been downloaded, check the Test POS for the latest version or ask Tobi for a copy. Copy into C:\CowisKasse\Update (or appropriate path) Whatever else may be in that folder needs to be deleted. Then unpack the file. Restart the POS program. This should start the update process.
description:
If the download for the update of the POS doesn't work, check first if it has been downloaded already. You can find in C:\CowisKasse\Update (or where ever the POS program is installed). Sometimes they run it from a network location.

It's called something like UpdateKasse-xxxxxx.zip. 

 

If it hasn't been downloaded, check the Test POS for the latest version or ask Tobi for a copy.

 

Copy into C:\CowisKasse\Update (or appropriate path)

 

Whatever else may be in that folder needs to be deleted. Then unpack the file.

 

Restart the POS program. This should start the update process.

title: VouchersGiftcards - maintenance on POS or BO
text: POS: Funktion -> GS Verwaltung erste Seite BO: Kassenabschlüsse -> Datei -> Gutscheine Choices: Offene Gutscheine (Open Vouchers/Giftcards) Eingelöste Gutscheine (Redeemed Vouchers/Giftcards) Alle Gutscheine (All Vouchers/Giftcards)
description:
POS: Funktion -> GS Verwaltung erste Seite 

 

 

BO: Kassenabschlüsse -> Datei -> Gutscheine

 

 

Choices:

 

Offene Gutscheine (Open Vouchers/Giftcards)

Eingelöste Gutscheine (Redeemed Vouchers/Giftcards)

Alle Gutscheine (All Vouchers/Giftcards)

title: Vouchersgiftcards - print a list
text: 14:46 If the client asks for a list of voucher codes, they can be exported from Cowis in an Excel-file: Kassenabschlüsse -> Datei -> Gutscheine -> offene Gutscheine -> Excel Export
description:
14:46

If the client asks for a list of voucher codes, they can be exported from Cowis in an Excel-file:

Kassenabschlüsse -> Datei -> Gutscheine -> offene Gutscheine -> Excel Export

title: Etiketten-Druck als Bildschirmanzeige erhalten
text: Kasse->Funktion->System->Formular-Verwaltung->Gewünschtes Formular auswählen und ändern->Drucker->Bildschirm
description: Kasse->Funktion->System->Formular-Verwaltung->Gewünschtes Formular auswählen und ändern->Drucker->Bildschirm

title: POS can't be opened - SQL Server Error
text: Error message: "Fehler beim Herstellen einer Verbindung mit SQL-Server. Der Server wurde nicht gefunden...." "DdD Cowis funktioniert nicht mehr Das Programm wird aufgrund eines Problems nicht richtig ausgeführt." Solution: Start the SQL-Server in Windows->Dienste
description:
Error message:

"Fehler beim Herstellen einer Verbindung mit SQL-Server. Der Server wurde nicht gefunden...."

"DdD Cowis funktioniert nicht mehr

Das Programm wird aufgrund eines Problems nicht richtig ausgeführt."

Solution: Start the SQL-Server in Windows->Dienste

title: How to activate the chargeback to card for an exchange
text: The standard returns for an exchange are cash or a voucher. If the customer wishes, you can also activate the card payment methods for returns In Cowi's back office, go to - System - Parameters - Payment methods select the card payment type with F7 (change), activate the checkbox for returns and save. After the next data exchange with the cash register, the function is available at the cash register.
description:
The standard returns for an exchange are cash or a voucher. 

If the customer wishes, you can also activate the card payment methods for returns


In Cowi's back office, go to 

- System

- Parameters

- Payment methods






select the card payment type with F7 (change), activate the checkbox for returns and save.

After the next data exchange with the cash register, the function is available at the cash register.

title: Learning file: Missing adresses
text: Sometimes not all addresses are transferred in a learning file and the cause cannot be found. Then you have to create a new learning file, preferably with a different name, then you can compare the sizes of the files created and decide which fits better.
description:
Sometimes not all addresses are transferred in a learning file and the cause cannot be found.


Then you have to create a new learning file, preferably with a different name, then you can compare the sizes of the files created and decide which fits better.

title: 2 x Bar appear at the POS in the daily closing
text: If 2 x bar tabs appear in the POS at a checkout, a learning file must be read in.
description: If 2 x bar tabs appear in the POS at a checkout, a learning file must be read in.

title: \MDE\Data_Read.exe
text: With the error message "The MDE import cannot take place. Please check the settings The transfer program was not found: \MDE\Data_Read.exe" proceed as follows: Explorer->Cowis->Select cash register->Utility Copy the address bar Cash register->Function->System->Cash register parameters->All parameters-> search for "SvmDETransfPgm" -> click on the parameter-> paste the previously copied address bar at the top right under "Input" and append "\data_read.exe " at the end->Ok->Save->restart cash register if necessary
description:
With the error message


"The MDE import cannot take place. Please check the settings


The transfer program was not found: \MDE\Data_Read.exe"



proceed as follows:




Explorer->Cowis->Select cash register->Utility




Copy the address bar



Cash register->Function->System->Cash register parameters->All parameters-> search for "SvmDETransfPgm" -> click on the parameter-> paste the previously copied address bar at the top right under "Input" and append "\data_read.exe " at the end->Ok->Save->restart cash register if necessary

title: Customer complains about a “hanging”, slow checkout
text: Some customers use the central cash register parameter "ArtImagePath" at the checkout (to be set in Cowis.Net Backoffice: Cash Statements -> File -> Cash Register Parameters -> ArtImagePath) As a rule, the path should point to the local image path at the checkout (usually C:\Cowis\Cowiskasse\Images\). All item images should be in this folder. (How they get there is not part of the solution article) However, some customers (namely e.g. Anthon Meyer Ticket #45307) have entered the path of the server with UNC address as an image path (e.g.: \\10.12.12.10\cowis\cowis.net\images) If the customer complains about a cash register that takes "forever" to jump to the new line after scanning the item and appears to be hanging, you can first check the following at the cash register: 1. Will item images be displayed when scanning (ask user at checkout) 2. Check the path of the image folder in the cash register parameters at the cash register (Function -> System -> Cash register parameters) 3. If a different path is entered in this path than the local pictures folder (C:\cowis\cowiskasse\Images\), deactivate the path at the checkout as a test. 4. To do this, click on the parameter and remove the entered path name, ignoring the message that you should not change a central parameter. 5. If the cash register behaves normally after restarting the cash register program, everything is good. What is the cause of this? With each scan, the cash register tries to load the corresponding image of the item from the server via the internet. If there are internet connectivity problems, it takes sooooo long that the customer gets the wrong impression that something is defective at the cash register.
description:
Some customers use the central cash register parameter "ArtImagePath" at the checkout (to be set in Cowis.Net Backoffice: Cash Statements -> File -> Cash Register Parameters -> ArtImagePath)


As a rule, the path should point to the local image path at the checkout (usually C:\Cowis\Cowiskasse\Images\). All item images should be in this folder. (How they get there is not part of the solution article)


However, some customers (namely e.g. Anthon Meyer Ticket #45307) have entered the path of the server with UNC address as an image path (e.g.: \\10.12.12.10\cowis\cowis.net\images)


If the customer complains about a cash register that takes "forever" to jump to the new line after scanning the item and appears to be hanging, you can first check the following at the cash register:


1. Will item images be displayed when scanning (ask user at checkout)

2. Check the path of the image folder in the cash register parameters at the cash register (Function -> System -> Cash register parameters)

3. If a different path is entered in this path than the local pictures folder (C:\cowis\cowiskasse\Images\), deactivate the path at the checkout as a test.

4. To do this, click on the parameter and remove the entered path name, ignoring the message that you should not change a central parameter.

5. If the cash register behaves normally after restarting the cash register program, everything is good.


What is the cause of this?

With each scan, the cash register tries to load the corresponding image of the item from the server via the internet. If there are internet connectivity problems, it takes sooooo long that the customer gets the wrong impression that something is defective at the cash register.

title: Display information about customer at checkout (customer information)
text: There is a parameter that controls the content of the address field at the checkout: this is the address from the Cowis.NEt back office This is the display at the checkout 1st line address ID customer since age 2nd line name 1 3rd line street 4th line postal code city controlled via the cash register parameter Cash accounts file Cash register parameters If you fill in the field in Cowis BO it will be shown to you at the checkout

this is the address from the Cowis.NEt back office


This is the display at the checkout



1st line address ID customer since age

2nd line name 1

3rd line street

4th line postal code city

controlled via the cash register parameter

Cash accounts

file

Cash register parameters




If you fill in the field in Cowis BO


it will be shown to you at the checkout

title: Hide site for transfers in the cash register
text: Warenwirtschaft->Artikel->Datei->Filialen->Filiale auswählen->Ändern->Aktiv-Haken entfernen->Datenaustausch ausführen
description: Warenwirtschaft->Artikel->Datei->Filialen->Filiale auswählen->Ändern->Aktiv-Haken entfernen->Datenaustausch ausführen

title: Save receipt forms
text: Firstly, we recommend that you back up the existing forms: 1. Cowiskasse -> Funktion -> System -> Formulare aus-/einlagern 2. Auslagern -> Ok 3. Alle -> Ok 4. Add today's date to the file name, as in this example: C:\COWIS\CowisKasse\DATEN\FORMULARE_11102022 5. Save
description:
Firstly, we recommend that you back up the existing forms:

1. Cowiskasse -> Funktion -> System -> Formulare aus-/einlagern

2. Auslagern -> Ok


3. Alle -> Ok



4. Add today's date to the file name, as in this example:
C:\COWIS\CowisKasse\DATEN\FORMULARE_11102022

5. Save

title: Cowis cash register only shows EAN and price, what happened?
text: So; the article data comes from the Cowis.Net back office in the data transfer to the cash register. If the user creates a new article in the Cowis.Net back office, prints a label and then goes to the cash register with it WITHOUT the data exchange having taken place, then scans the label at the Cowis cash register, then the cash register does not yet know all the information. The cash register can "learn" a barcode, i.e. the user scans the label and the cash register asks for the price and product group. This is the pop-up that shows "Barcode lernen" It apperas automaticlly when User is scanning an unknow Barcode at the POS This means that the cash register knows the EAN, but with further data transfer no further information is transmitted via this learned barcode. This is so that when a customer is at the POS with "new" goods, they can be sold to them. But it has the disadvantage that no further information is subsequently sent to the cash register. I have now emptied the "TblAtCodesLernen" table in the cash register database for the customer and then transmitted all article information to the cash register via a learning file. This is the query in SQL Management Studio to see the number of barcodes affected. You can then execute "truncate table dbo.TblAtCodesLernen" and the table will be emptied.
description:
So; the article data comes from the Cowis.Net back office in the data transfer to the cash register.


If the user creates a new article in the Cowis.Net back office, prints a label and then goes to the cash register with it WITHOUT the data exchange having taken place, then scans the label at the Cowis cash register, then the cash register does not yet know all the information.


The cash register can "learn" a barcode, i.e. the user scans the label and the cash register asks for the price and product group.


This is the pop-up that shows "Barcode lernen"

It apperas automaticlly when User is scanning an unknow Barcode at the POS


This means that the cash register knows the EAN, but with further data transfer no further information is transmitted via this learned barcode.


This is so that when a customer is at the POS with "new" goods, they can be sold to them. But it has the disadvantage that no further information is subsequently sent to the cash register.


I have now emptied the "TblAtCodesLernen" table in the cash register database for the customer and then transmitted all article information to the cash register via a learning file.





This is the query in SQL Management Studio to see the number of barcodes affected.


You can then execute "truncate table dbo.TblAtCodesLernen" and the table will be emptied.

title: Import Lerndatei
text: See German article
description: See German article

title: Identification of the seller at the Cowis cash register
text: Normally, the basic setting of the Cowis cash register is such that all sellers are displayed on the overview screen. Access can be protected by a password. (in the seller's master data in the Cowis.Net merchandise management system) However, there is also the option of processing identification using a barcode (or entering a code numerically) In the parameters for the Cowis cash register in the Cowis.Net back office, there is the parameter "KaSvVerkIdent". This controls the type of seller identification at the Cowis cash register. If you change this parameter and set it to "1", the login screen at the Cowis cash register looks like this: If you then enter either a barcode in plain text or a number (like 02543236 here) in the seller's master data in the Cowis.Net back office, the seller at the cash register can access the cash register using this number or card barcode. This is how it is intended to be handled
description:
Normally, the basic setting of the Cowis cash register is such that all sellers are displayed on the overview screen.

Access can be protected by a password.

(in the seller's master data in the Cowis.Net merchandise management system)

However, there is also the option of processing identification using a barcode (or entering a code numerically)



In the parameters for the Cowis cash register in the Cowis.Net back office, there is the parameter "KaSvVerkIdent". This controls the type of seller identification at the Cowis cash register.



If you change this parameter and set it to "1", the login screen at the Cowis cash register looks like this:

If you then enter either a barcode in plain text or a number (like 02543236 here) in the seller's master data in the Cowis.Net back office, the seller at the cash register can access the cash register using this number or card barcode.



This is how it is intended to be handled

title: Cowiskasse shows "Barcode learning"
text: If a Cowis internal EAN is scanned at the Cowis cash register that the cash register does not yet know, this window appears. Here, customers usually only enter the price and can then sell the item and the inventory is also processed correctly in the Cowis.Net back office. BUT: The cash register "knows" this barcode and, even after the data exchange has taken place, never shows all the information about the item, but only the EAN and the price. A solution can only be found (as far as I know) by intervening in the database. See help article: "Cowis cash register only shows internal EAN and price" https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/articles/103000299735-cowis-cash-register-only-shows-ean-and-price-what-happened-
description:
If a Cowis internal EAN is scanned at the Cowis cash register that the cash register does not yet know, this window appears.




Here, customers usually only enter the price and can then sell the item and the inventory is also processed correctly in the Cowis.Net back office.


BUT:

The cash register "knows" this barcode and, even after the data exchange has taken place, never shows all the information about the item, but only the EAN and the price.


A solution can only be found (as far as I know) by intervening in the database.

See help article: "Cowis cash register only shows internal EAN and price"
https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/articles/103000299735-cowis-cash-register-only-shows-ean-and-price-what-happened-

title: Create a payment method for the Cowis cash register
text: To create a payment method for the cash register, a Cowis user logs into the Cowis.Net back office. Go to System Then to Parameters Select payment methods In this window, all payment methods that are defined are displayed Description -> Name of the payment method (length limited) Sorting -> Order of display on the Cowis cash register Sales -> Whether the payment method should generate sales (the user must decide) Bank -> Only cash payments must have the checkbox activated here Account number -> may play a role in a financial accounting connection Telecash -> if the checkbox is activated, the payment method is transferred to a connected payment terminal Return -> if activated, the payment method for reimbursement can be selected when goods are returned (exchanged) The transfer of a newly created payment method takes place via the data exchange A new payment method is created as with all usual processes in Cowis using the NEW button Then you enter the values you want and save them
description:
To create a payment method for the cash register, a Cowis user logs into the Cowis.Net back office.

Go to System


Then to Parameters


Select payment methods


In this window, all payment methods that are defined are displayed


Description -> Name of the payment method (length limited)

Sorting -> Order of display on the Cowis cash register

Sales -> Whether the payment method should generate sales (the user must decide)

Bank -> Only cash payments must have the checkbox activated here

Account number -> may play a role in a financial accounting connection

Telecash -> if the checkbox is activated, the payment method is transferred to a connected payment terminal

Return -> if activated, the payment method for reimbursement can be selected when goods are returned (exchanged)


The transfer of a newly created payment method takes place via the data exchange


A new payment method is created as with all usual processes in Cowis using the NEW button


Then you enter the values you want and save them

title: Recording working hours in Cowiskasse
text: Working hours and breaks can be recorded in the Cowiskasse. Corrections are NOT possible in the Cowiskasse. To carry out the recording, the seller logs in to the cash register Then select the function The Time Recording button can be found on the Advanced tab Once selected, you must select your seller name again After identification, the window for recording the type of time recording opens. Cowiskasse differentiates between "coming" and "going" When you have arrived for work, press "coming" The coming entry is set Then press close Break When you go on a break, you normally select going So you go the same way again: Function -> Advanced -> Time recording (in this example, the employee worked for 2 minutes before going on a break) When you return from the break, you obviously have to book coming again, so the route is again Function -> Advanced -> Time Recording End of work When you have finished work or your shift is over, use the going function in time recording one last time Function -> Advanced -> Time recording This concludes the working day. You can of course make as many coming and going bookings on one day as you like. Cowiskasse is not limited to a number here. Likewise, the way in which the coming and going bookings are made is generally specified by your employer. The evaluation of working hours takes place in the Cowis.Net back office
description:
Working hours and breaks can be recorded in the Cowiskasse.

Corrections are NOT possible in the Cowiskasse.


To carry out the recording, the seller logs in to the cash register




Then select the function


The Time Recording button can be found on the Advanced tab


Once selected, you must select your seller name again



After identification, the window for recording the type of time recording opens.

Cowiskasse differentiates between "coming" and "going"


When you have arrived for work, press "coming"

The coming entry is set

Then press close



Break

When you go on a break, you normally select going

So you go the same way again:

Function -> Advanced -> Time recording

(in this example, the employee worked for 2 minutes before going on a break)



When you return from the break, you obviously have to book coming again, so the route is again

Function -> Advanced -> Time Recording




End of work

When you have finished work or your shift is over, use the going function in time recording one last time

Function -> Advanced -> Time recording


This concludes the working day.

You can of course make as many coming and going bookings on one day as you like. Cowiskasse is not limited to a number here. Likewise, the way in which the coming and going bookings are made is generally specified by your employer.



The evaluation of working hours takes place in the Cowis.Net back office

title: Cowiskasse: Printer setup for Cowiskasse
text: The Cowiskasse is very undemanding when it comes to the POS printer. Any printer that understands the Windows printer language "Generic / Text only" can be connected. As a rule, a thermal printer such as Epson TMT, Metapace or Oxhoo will be used at a POS. The printer must be installed in Windows; the Cowiskasse does not care whether the connection is a USB connection, a serial connection or a parallel connection. Sometimes it can happen that USB printers are not recognized as such (Windows-specific) In such a case, we recommend installing the serial software emulator provided by the printer manufacturer. For Epson, for example, this is "TMVirtualPortDriver". This emulates a serial connection from a USB connection The Windows printer should then be called "Cowis-Bon" most simply, and this is then stored in the Cowiskasse as a logical printer.
description:
The Cowiskasse is very undemanding when it comes to the POS printer.


Any printer that understands the Windows printer language "Generic / Text only" can be connected.


As a rule, a thermal printer such as Epson TMT, Metapace or Oxhoo will be used at a POS.


The printer must be installed in Windows; the Cowiskasse does not care whether the connection is a USB connection, a serial connection or a parallel connection.


Sometimes it can happen that USB printers are not recognized as such (Windows-specific)

In such a case, we recommend installing the serial software emulator provided by the printer manufacturer.


For Epson, for example, this is "TMVirtualPortDriver". This emulates a serial connection from a USB connection


The Windows printer should then be called "Cowis-Bon" most simply, and this is then stored in the Cowiskasse as a logical printer.

title: Cowiskasse does not start, an error message appears
text: Good to know: The Cowiskasse absolutely requires the so-called SQL server from Microsoft to be used. This is a program from Microsoft that manages all of your Cowiskasse data. The installation and setup is carried out by DdD. The SQL server usually always starts automatically and does not cause any problems. (You will notice the restriction) In certain situations it may happen that the SQL server has not yet started, but the Cowiskasse already wants to access it, in which case you will receive a message like this: You can now try to get the SQL server to start before the Cowiskasse needs it by restarting the cash register computer, or you can use this short "How do I help myself?" You need the local service operator of the Windows operating system: You click on the Windows start symbol (this can look like Windows 10, or be the well-known Windows 7 "ball"), you can also press the Windows symbol on your keyboard. Now you can simply type in the word "Services". (Basically you could also write "Dienste", but since there is a possibility that you have an English operating system, "Dienste" would not help you, whereas the German operating system can handle both "Dienste" and "Services".) The "tree" opens, which shows you the program with the highest match in the first place, this should be Dienste (or Services). You open this program by clicking on it A new window opens with the title "Services" (or Services) Now scroll with the scroll bar on the right until you get to the letter S There you look for an entry that contains the word "SQL Server". Usually followed by the word "COWIS" or "COWISKASSE", i.e. "SQL Server COWIS" or "SQL SERVER COWISKASSE". There will (most likely) be nothing in the "Status" column and "automatic" in the startup type column. This means that the SQL Server should "actually" start automatically but is not currently running. To start the SQL Server, click on the entry once with the left mouse button so that it is highlighted in blue. Now click on "start" in the top left corner In the best case, the status has changed to "running" and you can close the window and then start your Cowiskasse normally again. If you are unsure, it is always a good choice to contact support if possible.
description:
Good to know:

The Cowiskasse absolutely requires the so-called SQL server from Microsoft to be used.


This is a program from Microsoft that manages all of your Cowiskasse data. The installation and setup is carried out by DdD.


The SQL server usually always starts automatically and does not cause any problems. (You will notice the restriction)


In certain situations it may happen that the SQL server has not yet started, but the Cowiskasse already wants to access it, in which case you will receive a message like this:


You can now try to get the SQL server to start before the Cowiskasse needs it by restarting the cash register computer, or you can use this short "How do I help myself?"


You need the local service operator of the Windows operating system:

You click on the Windows start symbol (this can look like Windows 10, or be the well-known Windows 7 "ball"), you can also press the Windows symbol on your keyboard.


Now you can simply type in the word "Services".


(Basically you could also write "Dienste", but since there is a possibility that you have an English operating system, "Dienste" would not help you, whereas the German operating system can handle both "Dienste" and "Services".)


The "tree" opens, which shows you the program with the highest match in the first place, this should be Dienste (or Services).


You open this program by clicking on it



A new window opens with the title "Services" (or Services)



Now scroll with the scroll bar on the right until you get to the letter S



There you look for an entry that contains the word "SQL Server". Usually followed by the word "COWIS" or "COWISKASSE", i.e. "SQL Server COWIS" or "SQL SERVER COWISKASSE".



There will (most likely) be nothing in the "Status" column and "automatic" in the startup type column. This means that the SQL Server should "actually" start automatically but is not currently running.



To start the SQL Server, click on the entry once with the left mouse button so that it is highlighted in blue.


Now click on "start" in the top left corner





In the best case, the status has changed to "running" and you can close the window and then start your Cowiskasse normally again.


If you are unsure, it is always a good choice to contact support if possible.

title: Send complete inventory data again
text: Es gibt die Möglichkeit nochmals alle auf der Kasse vorhanden Inventurdaten (Scans) an die Warenwirtschaft zu senden. Welche Inventurdaten genau auf der Kasse liegen kann über Funktion ->Daten->Inventur erfassen->Alle anzeigen eingesehen werden. Damit hier immer nur eine Inventur liegt und nicht mehrere verschiedene, empfiehlt es sich immer alle alte Inventurdaten von der Kasse zu löschen, bevor man eine neue Inventur beginnt (Funktion ->Daten->Inventur erfassen->Inv. löschen->Alle Daten löschen) Das erneute Senden aller Inventurdaten an die Warenwirtschaft kann man über die Service-Prozedur "InvNochmalKomplettSenden" ausführen: Kasse - Funktionen- System- Service Prozeduren - InvNochmalKomplettSenden - Start
description:
Es gibt die Möglichkeit nochmals alle auf der Kasse vorhanden Inventurdaten (Scans) an die Warenwirtschaft zu senden.

Welche Inventurdaten genau auf der Kasse liegen kann über Funktion ->Daten->Inventur erfassen->Alle anzeigen eingesehen werden. Damit hier immer nur eine Inventur liegt und nicht mehrere verschiedene, empfiehlt es sich immer alle alte Inventurdaten von der Kasse zu löschen, bevor man eine neue Inventur beginnt (Funktion ->Daten->Inventur erfassen->Inv. löschen->Alle Daten löschen)

Das erneute Senden aller Inventurdaten an die Warenwirtschaft kann man über die Service-Prozedur "InvNochmalKomplettSenden" ausführen:

Kasse - Funktionen- System- Service Prozeduren - InvNochmalKomplettSenden - Start

title: Change the cash limit in POS
text: If a customer calls and says that they are trying to sell for more than DKK 15.000 and the POS refuses them, you need to change the limit in DdDAdmin. First and foremost, unless the customer says otherwise, park the note. That way they don't have to rescan everything. Make sure you're logged in with a user who has administrator rights. Go to DdDAdmin Choose the store and the machine and click on Change this machine only. Scroll down to Adv. configuration Scroll down to MaxCashAmount and change this to e.g. 30000 or anything above the amount they want to sell for. Remember to scroll down to the bottom and click Save. Close the window, cancle the sale and run a reload on the POS. Now they can sell for up to DKK 30.000.
description:
If a customer calls and says that they are trying to sell for more than DKK 15.000 and the POS refuses them, you need to change the limit in DdDAdmin.



First and foremost, unless the customer says otherwise, park the note. That way they don't have to rescan everything.


Make sure you're logged in with a user who has administrator rights.



Go to DdDAdmin



Choose the store and the machine and click on Change this machine only.



Scroll down to Adv. configuration



Scroll down to MaxCashAmount and change this to e.g. 30000 or anything above the amount they want to sell for.



Remember to scroll down to the bottom and click Save.


Close the window, cancle the sale and run a reload on the POS.


Now they can sell for up to DKK 30.000.
